Pre-Game Insights: Manager Lionel Scaloni has confirmed that Lionel Messi will start for Argentina against Guatemala at FedEx Field in Landover, Maryland, as they finalize their preparations for Copa América.
Messi, 36, came off the bench in Argentina's opening warmup game against Ecuador on Sunday, with Scaloni saying they would manage the forward's minutes in the lead-up to the tournament.
Messi has dealt with muscle injuries while playing for Inter Miami this season, with Argentina making sure he remains fit for Copa América.
Scaloni confirmed Messi will start against Guatemala and could play the whole match.
Scaloni is yet to announce his final 26-player roster, waiting until after the Ecuador game to make the final cuts.
